item.title: Bea add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Bea add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "From now on, ending a sentence with a preposition is something up with which I will not put." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Bea add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope" -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Bea add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "in times like the present, men should utter nothing for which they would not willingly be responsible through time and eternity." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Bea add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "You can only come to the morning through the shadows." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Bea add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "When the day shall come that we do part," he said softly, and turned to look at me, "if my last words are not 'I love you'-ye'll ken it was because I didna have time." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Bea add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I prayed all the way up that hill yesterday, he said softly. Not for you to stay; I didna think that would be right. I prayed I'd be strong enough to send ye away. He shook his head, still gazing up the hill, a faraway look in his eyes. I said 'Lord, if I've never had courage in my life before, let me have it now. Let me be brave enough not to fall on my knees and beg her to stay.' He pulled his eyes away from the cottage and smiled briefly at me. Hardest thing I ever did, Sassenach." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Bea add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
